sentences: Tord Gustavsen (born 5 October 1970) is a Norwegian jazz pianist and composer.
Gustavsen was born on 5 October 1970 in Oslo and raised in rural Hurdal, Akershus.
Gustavsen holds a bachelor's degree (mellomfag) in psychology at the University of Oslo, before he attended the Trondheim Musikkonsevatorium for a three years study of jazz (1993–96).
Thereafter he became a graduate (Cand.philol.) of musicology at the University of Oslo, where he was guest teacher of jazz piano and theory (1998–2002).
The trio won the Nattjazz prize in 2005.
That year, Gustavsen played over four days at the Montreal Jazz Festival: with the quartet, as a solo pianist and in a duo with vocalist Solveig Slettahjell.
Since 2014 Gustavsen has collaborated with the German-Afghan jazz singer Simin Tander, releasing the album What Was Said (2016).
